meanings.definition: The state or quality of being irrecoverable.
meanings.sent1: The irrecoverableness of the lost treasure left the explorers feeling defeated.
meanings.sent2: The irrecoverableness of the stolen item made the owner sad.
meanings.sent3: The irrecoverableness of the missing sock was a mystery that puzzled everyone.
meanings.sent4: The irrecoverableness of time slipping away is like trying to catch a fleeting shadow.
meanings.sent5: The irrecoverableness of a broken mirror reflects the fragility of life.

meanings.definition: The inability to be regained or recovered.
meanings.sent1: She felt the irrecoverableness of her lost keys as she searched in vain.
meanings.sent2: The irrecoverableness of the stolen car left the owner feeling helpless.
meanings.sent3: The irrecoverableness of the missing puzzle piece made the picture incomplete.
meanings.sent4: The irrecoverableness of a shattered dream can be heartbreaking.
meanings.sent5: The irrecoverableness of a broken promise can damage trust irreparably.
